El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para compra de alimentos balanceados y des esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Joselito is 39 years old and lives with his family in Matanza district, a quiet community. Its population is dedicated to cultivating rice and lemons, and commerce in small animals. It is located in Morropon, two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru. 

With the help of his wife, he sells small livestock such as guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens. His business is located in the backyard of his home. He requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced animal feed and thus have better products to offer to his clients, which will generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a balanced diet to fatten up his small livestock

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus nietos en la la zona rural de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, agricultura y comercio, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Juanita como así la conocen en su zona nos explica, que se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de animales menores, contribuyendo con su esposo en el sostenimiento de su hogar.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edyme Altenativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para sus vacas y así tener una mejor producción de leche para ofrecerlo en el mercado de la zona y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 66 years old. She lives with her husband and their grandchildren in a rural zone of Cayalti. Its population works in cultivating sugar cane, rice, agriculture, and business. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru.

Juanita, as she is known in her area, raises dairy cattle and sells small animals, contributing with her husband to the sustenance of the household.

She has applied to Edyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN to buy balanced feed for her cows and thus have a better production of milk to offer in the local market, and in this way to have greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for better milk production from her cows.

loans.name: Monowara

texts.en:
Monowara is a 35-year-old married woman who has two children. Both of them receive an education. Monowara passed class V (grade 5), while her husband is illiterate, just knowing how to sign his name. Her husband is 42 years old. 

Monowara is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. They live in the small town of Dhupguri. They own a small plot of land on which her husband cultivates crops. As the plot of land belongs to them, the whole profit comes to them only. 

Monowara has taken the loan to buy seeds for potato cultivation so that they can enhance their business and can cultivate another variety of vegetable and can earn more. 

They dream to give a good and bright future to their children. Monowara also hopes they can shift to a pakka house (a house made of bricks and cement) from a kaccha house (a house made of straw, bamboo, etc.). They are thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending the helping hand.

loans.use: to buy seeds for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila, her husband and their four children live in the small town of Dhupguri.  All the children are educated. Both Laila and her husband are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. 

Laila takes care of animals and earns money by selling the milk and milk products, while her husband is engaged in selling vegetables at the market. Both Laila and her husband struggle a lot and try to earn money so that their children don’t need to struggle like them. 

From the beginning, Laila has reared different animals like hens, goats, etc. Now she wants to earn more, so she has applied to BJS for a loan of INR 15,000 so that she can purchase a cow. She can sell its milk and milk products in the market. 

Laila is a very courageous woman, and she is confident that one day will come when she will not require any loan from anyone; that she can be self-sufficient to earn money, support her family and fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 41-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Ramaz
loans.use: to purchase a car and start firewood transportation from the forest.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Mebelyng, es madre soltera de dos niños de 5 y 2 años, originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Es una mujer trabajadora y muy luchadora, tiene 30 años de edad y cuenta con 13 años de experiencia en el ramo de la belleza. Hace dos años estableció  su propio salón de belleza, construido de madera y zinc, ubicado en un lugar donde transita mucha gente, lo cual le permite tener buena clientela con los servicios que ofrece de peinados, cortes de cabello para hombres y mujeres, alisados, planchados, pistoleado, maquillaje, entre otros. Cada diciembre emplea a dos ayudantes por la alta demanda que tiene durante la temporada. 

Ella solicita el préstamo para adquirir una plancha de cabello y otras herramientas propias de belleza, que le permitirán atender la demanda que se le aproxima.

En Pana Pana ya ha tenido dos préstamos como parte del grupo solidario, con lo cual ha ido fortaleciendo su pequeño negocio con productos de belleza y compró dos vitrinas. 

Nelsy: Es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que ha establecido una pequeña pulpería donde vende gaseosas, agua purificada, jugos, tortillas y enchiladas que ella misma prepara. Tiene una niña de 5 años y es la coordinadora del grupo solidario. El pequeño local es alquilado y paga cincuenta córdobas por día. Estudia los sábados en la modalidad de secundaria acelerada porque quiere llegar a ser una profesional en el futuro. Sueña con tener su casa propia, construida de cemento, pues ahorita tiene que pagar alquiler. Solicita financiamiento para surtir su pulpería. 

Leonarda: Es madre soltera de dos hijos de 12 y 6 años. Ella tiene una pulpería en su vivienda donde vende chiverías, pan, gaseosas, pero además vende frijoles cocidos, nacatamales y tortilla de maíz. Está solicitando el préstamos para incrementar el inventario de su pulpería además de comprar un quintal de frijoles para la venta de frijoles cocidos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda grande con varios productos que le generen más ingresos.
texts.en:
Mebelyng is a single mother of two children, ages 5 and 2. She is a native of the city of Bilwi. She is hard-working and striving. She is 30 years old and has 13 years of experience in the area of beauty. Two years ago she established her own beauty salon, constructed of wood and zinc, located in a place where many people pass by, which allows her to have a good customer base with the services that she offers of hair styling, haircuts for men and women, straightening, ironing, blow-drying, and makeup, among others. Every December she employs two assistants because of the high demand that she has during that season.

She is applying for the loan to acquire a hair iron and other beauty tools of her own, which will allow her to respond to the demand that she experiences.

She has already had two loans from Pana Pana as part of her communal group. With them, she has strengthened her little business with beauty  products and bought two display cases.

Nelsy: She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has established a little grocery story where she sells soft drinks, purified water, juices, and tortillas and enchiladas that she herself prepares. She has a daughter who is five years old, and she is the coordinator of the communal group. Her little shop is rented, and she pays 50 cordobas a day. On Saturdays she goes to school in an accelerated secondary program, because in the future she wants to have a career. She dreams of having her own house, made of cement, since now she has to pay rent. She is applying for a loan to stock her grocery store.

Leonarda: She is a single mother of two children, ages 12 and 6. She has a grocery store in her home, where she sells snacks, bread, and soft drinks, but in addition she sells cooked beans, nactamales (Nicaraguan tamales), and corn tortillas. She is applying for the loan to increase the inventory of her grocery store, in addition to buying a quintal (about 100 lbs) of beans to sell as cooked beans. Her dream is to eventually have a big store with various products that will generate more income for her.

loans.use: to acquire a hair iron and other beauty tools of her own, which will allow her to respond to the demand that she experiences.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 20 years old and lives in the town of Iganga, Uganda. She has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her business, which operates in cooked food for the hotel.

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food stuff for the hotel and will help Brenda to generate greater profits. This will, in turn, be used to pay fees for her children. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a fridge.

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase food stuff for the hotel.

loans.name: Jose Genaro

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad reside en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. José trabaja como vigilante desde hace mucho tiempo  y es así como mantiene su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones y las de su esposa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir la compra de cemento, arena y lámina galvanizada ya que desea encementar el piso y reparar el techo de la vivienda deteriorado por las lluvias.
texts.en:
José, 47, lives in his own house with his life partner who works in domestic help. 

José,has worked as a security guard for a long time which is how he maintains his home. 

With the desire to improve his and his wife's conditions, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and galvanized sheet so he can pave the floor and fix the roof which has deteriorated with rain.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and galvanized sheet so he can pave the floor and fix the roof.

loans.name: Simon Honorato

texts.es:
Simon en un hombre muy trabajador en cual se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, el posee una pequeña parcela en la ciudad de Camana, que es la ciudad donde el vive actualmente. Simón le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que siempre esta al pendiente del crecimiento de su cultivo, por ello cree que le va bien.

Simon está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, brindar mantenimiento al cultivo, entre otros; lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ser un gran agricultor”.
texts.en:
Simon is a very hardworking man who has dedicated himself to agriculture for many years. He owns a small plot of land in the city of Camana, which is the city where he currently lives. Simon spends about 9 hours per day cultivating it as he is always watching over the growth of his crops, and he feels it is going well because of that. 

Simon is grateful to Kiva lenders as thanks to the help they have provided him, he can purchase manure and fertilizer, maintain his crops, etc. which allows him to continue to strive to realize his greatest dream: "To be a great farmer."

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en la zona rural de La Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio de animales menores y ganadería, que pertenece a Morropon, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia que se dedican a la venta de animales menores pavos, gallinas, cerdos y chivos, conocidos en la zona por la labor que realizan. Vidal ha solicitado u préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales menores para llevar a ofrecerlos a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vidal is 52 years old and lives with his wife in the rural area of La Matanza, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce in small animals, and animal husbandry. It is located in Morropon, two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Along with his family, he dedicates himself to the sale of small livestock such as turkeys, hens, pigs, and goats. They are known in the area for the work they do. Vidal has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to purchase more animals to bring to sell in villages adjacent to his community and earn additional income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock such as pigs and goats

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 59-year-old married man.  He has 6 children between the ages of 10 and 25 years old.  He describes himself to be God-fearing.  He operates a carpentry business where he sells tables, chairs, etc. to earn a living.  He will use the KES 7,900 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house.  He hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
Fallah is a 22-year-old Iraqi client. He is single and lives with his family, which is composed of two members. Fallah is the sole provider of his family.

Fallah is a carpenter who specializes in making doors, windows, and furniture. After working for several years and gaining experience at a carpenter's shop, Fallah established his own business in 2012. He has already hired an employee. Thanks to his clean work and affordable prices, Fallah became well-known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Fallah is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to buy a specialized wood-cutting machine and to increase his lumber inventory. Fallah is aiming to grow his business and to increase his profits so that he may provide himself a stable career and a good source of income.

loans.use: to buy a specialized wood-cutting machine and to increase his lumber inventory.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es: Natividad tiene 47 años de edad y es el soporte económico para su hogar. Habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a sus hijos de 19, 15 y 13 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Natividad se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y cereales. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su principal patrimonio es su humilde vivienda la cual necesita un muro de retención lo antes posible ya que las lluvias están desbordando el terreno y afecta su vivienda. Además, desea hacer un servicio sanitario ya que el que tiene se encuentra en malas condiciones. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y lámina para hacer el muro y reparar el baño sanitario lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Natividad is 47 years old and the economic support for her household. She lives in very modest circumstances with her children, ages 19,15 and 13, who are in school. Natividad sells fruits, vegetables and grains. This business is her main source of income. 

Her main asset is her modest house, which needs a retaining wall as soon as possible, as the rains are overflowing her plot of land and affecting her home. In addition she wishes to do work the bathroom, as the one she has is in poor repair. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel and sheet metal for building the wall and repairing the bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and sheet metal in order to build a retaining wall and repair the bathroom.

loans.name: Darkul

texts.ru: Даркул 22 года, замужем. У Даркул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Даркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 2 года назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Даркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 1 коза, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Даркул входит в группу "Алмалуу", в эту группу входят еще 3 человека. Даркул является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Даркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Даркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома в селе.
texts.en: Darkul is 22 and married, with a secondary education. She raises livestock as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started two years ago with the purchase of cattle for 30,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her holding now includes three milk cows, two horses, one goat and 10 sheep, with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Darkul is a member of the group "Almaluu" along with two other people. With the intention of further developing her business, she has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy calves to increase her head count. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of the size of her herd, and to save toward the purchase of a house in the village.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Parizat

texts.ru: Паризат 26 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Паризат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Паризат занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Паризат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 овцы, 3 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Паризат входит в группу "Алмалуу", в эту группу входят еще 3 человека. Паризат является четвертым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Паризат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Паризат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на образование для своих детей.
texts.en: Parizat is 26 and married with three children. She has a secondary education and raises livestock as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started five years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her holding now contains two milk cows, two sheep and three goats, with a monthly income of 7,000 KGS. Parizat belongs to the Almaluu group along with three other people. With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase sheep to increase her head count. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of her herd and to save toward her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Deysi Medalith

texts.es:
Deysi Medalith tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Lagunas, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña para luego comercializarlo a la Empresa azucarera de la zona, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen un pequeño negocio de artículos de ferretería y repuestos de moto, son una familia joven y emprendedora, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con diversos articulo de ferretería tubos, calaminas, clavos, etc y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi Medalith is 19 years old and lives with her husband in Lagunas district. Its inhabitants grow sugarcane to sell at the sugar company in the area, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast.

She and her husband have a small business selling hardware items and motorcycle spare parts. They are a young and enterprising family. She has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles for stocking their business with various hardware items such as pipes, sheet metal, nails, etc., in order to generate   greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy hardware items: sheet metal, pipes, nails, for stocking her business.

loans.name: Joan Manuel

texts.es:
Joan tiene 20 años y vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja como empleado de seguridad en un fundo agrícola y con este trabajo puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, Jon cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque su responsabilidad y sobre todo su honestidad.

Joan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder colocar el piso de la habitación donde vive y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and lives in the city is Ica. He works as a security guard at a farm, and with this work can have income so that he can get ahead in life. Joan believes his work is going well because of his sense of responsibility, and especially his honesty. 

He is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided him he will be able to buy construction materials to install a floor in the room where he lives. This way he can improve his quality of life and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality,"To have my own house."

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Khemesse's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 19 femmes fait parti du Banc villageois créé le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé de membres dynamiques et solidaires qui font comme activités le commerce et l'embouche.
Khemesse, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 01 garçon. Avec le prêt, elle compte faire de l'embouche ovine. elle fait cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le BV. Elle va acheter un mouton à 40 000 F qu'elle va élever et avec le reste de l'argent acheter de la nourriture de bétail et aussi pourvoir aux soins vétérinaires. Elle va élever le mouton et au bout de 05 mois le revendre à 75 000 F.
Avec les bénéfices, elle renforce son épargne et va entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 19 women is part of the 'banc villageois' created on December 13, 2008. It is composed of energetic members in solidarity with one another. Their businesses involve commerce and livestock farming. 

Khemesse, who is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 38 years old, married, and the mother of ten children, including one boy. With this loan, she intends to fatten sheep. She has been in this business since joining the 'banc villageois'. She is going to purchase a head of sheep at 40,000 francs that she will raise. With the rest of the money, she will purchase feed and also be able to afford veterinary care. She will raise the sheep and sell it for 75,000 francs after five months. With the profits, she bolsters her savings and will care for her children.

loans.use: to raise sheep

loans.name: Akolly

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits d'alimentation générale, mr Akolly sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit. Il a démarré en 2003 et s'approvisionne à Lomé. Il espère réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans l'activité et assurer au mieux aux besoins de la famille(âgé de 38ans, il est marié et père d'un enfant de 04ans).
texts.en: To purchase grocery items, Mr. Akolly is requesting an initial loan from WAGES. Having started off in 2003, he supplies himself from Lomé. He hopes to reinvest his extra profits in his business and do his utmost to meet the needs of his family. Mr. Akolly is 38 years old, married, and a father of a 4-year-old child.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza  is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cream relaxers and braids. She generates additional income from farming. She works from home seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of cosmetics. She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is a 23-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as God fearing. He operates a motorcycle transport business whereby he transports customers using his motorcycle. He will use the KES 7,900 loan to buy a solar lamp to light his house. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Enji Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower of Enji's group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. Zeinab is a 38-year-old married mother of four children. She works in the clothes selling business to support her family, where she is responsible for the living of six family members. Zeinab's acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise. She will increase the winter collection with new released items.

Zeinab's previous loans were invested in switching her business type from the used clothes trade to new items exported from Turkey. She is the first lady from the right. As for the other group members, Nawal is in the middle, and Samiha is the first from the left.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special winter items

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif is a 35-year-old married person who is raising two children together with his wife. Akif is a cattle breeder with more than 15 years of experience. He purchases small calves and then fattens and raises them. After six months, he resells the grown cattle in the central city market. He applied for a 2000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle and increase his income. This loan will allow him to improve the life of his family. He has a good loan history and this is going to be his fourth loan.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and increase his income

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old and earns a living running her own business, and she's been selling maize for 12 years. She gets help from her daughter who helps to sell and serve customers better. In this way, Cecilia is able to generate enough income to contribute towards her household expenses. Currently she is asking for the loan amount of 2,000 GHS to buy two big bags of maize to sell to customers. This will also allow her to have enough stock to meet the demand for products and to face the various challenges caused by unexpected rises in maize price. This affects her finances and her customers since the prices are very variable and unstable. By doing this she will be able to increase sales and the income she makes. 

Cecilia says she wants to continue working hard to move her business forward. She wants to fulfill her dream of owning a supply shop, which will give her better profits and income to improve her family's well being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two big bags of maize and sell to customers.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 19 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Getrude has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which deals with chicken. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more feed for the chicken. It will help Getrude to generate greater profits and help her to provide necessitates for her family. Getrude hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for the chicken.

loans.name: Receb

texts.en: Receb is 58 years of age and married. He is an established farmer who has done this work for 24 years. On his farm, he rears dairy cows and poultry. Receb's sons help him in this business. He enjoys farming, because, as he says, it's a source of income for him. In order to expand his business, Receb  asked the Aqroinvest CU for a loan in the amount of 1,900 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy cows for cattle breeding. This loan will help him purchase a dairy cow, which will add more income and better his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cows for cattle breeding

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is 23 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past five years, Zaid has been working hard to manage her jewelry shop, which deals in different kinds of jewelry. To help expand her business, Zaid has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials like beads and will help Zaid to generate greater profits and to be able to pay fees for her child. Zaid hopes that in the future she will be able to start a wholesale shop. 

Zaid is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for her jewelry shop

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is a 29-year-old married man with one daughter. He deals in the business of animal sales. He buys animals, such as baby goats and calves, at low prices, raises them, and sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

Yashar is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. He makes enough through his business to contribute to the family income. However, he needs to improve his business to bear his household expenses. For this reason, he contacted Aqroinvest CU and applied for a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase another calf. With this loan, he will definitely expand his business and increase his income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 51 years of age. He is a married person. For the last two years, he has been working growing fruits and vegetables with his wife. They have their own plot of land, located 10 minutes from their home. Every day Ibrahim goes out with his wife; they work hard, but with enthusiasm, they look after and clean their vegetables in the belief that they will have an excellent harvest. With an excellent harvest, they can generate a higher income. 

Ibrahim is in need of a loan of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) in order to buy farming supplies. He needs to buy fertilizers, seeds and other items.

In the future, Ibrahim dreams of expanding his crops by planting and growing a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables. This way, he can earn a higher income that would allow him to prosper with his family and to give them better opportunities in life. Ibrahim wants to educate his children so that, in the future, they become prepared visionaries who will look after the inheritance Ibrahim will leave them.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, including fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moureen is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 1 year, Moureen has been working hard to manage her matooke business, which deals in the sale of matooke. 

To help expand her business, Moureen has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bunches of matooke and will help Moureen to generate greater profits and pay house rent. Moureen hopes that in the future she will be able to  buy a sawing machine. 

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"




"

loans.use: to buy more bunches of matooke.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 20 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Constance has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which deals in sewing different designs of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Constance has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials and a sewing machine and will help Constance to generate greater profits  and be able to construct a house. Constance hopes that in the future she will be able to go for further studies. 

Constance is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Keydy

texts.es:
La joven es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, desde hace 6 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y también sale a vender a diversos lugares aledaños. 
Keydy necesita el préstamo para la compra blusas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, chores, etc. y tener suficiente producto para la venta ya que en esta época navideña sus clientes le demandan mas mercadería. 
Keydy con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes, desea poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Keydy espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Keydy is a hardworking and responsible young woman who lives with her family in a community in southern Honduras. Her business involves selling clothes and has been in existence for six years. Keydy operates her business from her home in the town where she lives, but she also sells in different places nearby.

She needs this loan so that she can buy blouses, trousers, dresses, skirts, shirts, shorts, and other items in order to have sufficient inventory to sell. Since the Christmas season is approaching, her customers are demanding more merchandise. With this loan Keydy expects to increase her sales. The loan will be of great help since she does not have the necessary products to fulfill the orders from her customers.

Keydy wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family a little bit with the increase in her household income. In the short-term, she hopes to grow her business, continue supporting her family, and provide her children the education they need to have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, dresses, skirts, shirts, shorts, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir lives in Yerevan with his parents, wife and two little children. He is a hairdresser with seven years of experience working in beauty salon. In a rented stall of the beauty salon, Vladimir provides different types of hairdressing services. Due to his professional work, Vladimir has a list of loyal customers who use only his services. Now, this talented hairdresser asks for a loan to purchase supplies that he needs for his work, like dyes and scissors.
 
Vladimir has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Vladimir to enlarge his business and to be able to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies that he needs for his work, like dyes and scissors.

loans.name: Nivah

texts.en: Nivah is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a grocery stall where she sells groceries. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 12,900 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house. She hopes that in the future, she will open other businesses and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Abuzar

texts.en:
Abuzar is 35 years of age, married, and is raising two children with his wife. Two years ago, he decided to open a business so that he could support his family, which is comprised of his wife and two children. He works together with his two assistants in a small cafeteria, which he built through hard work and sacrifice. His business is well-known due to its strategic location and good service.

Abuzar's biggest dream is to expand his business so that he can service more customers. Therefore, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to remodel and buy inventory. He hopes to send his children to college.

loans.use: to remodel and buy inventory.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Nazca y con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de herramientas para maquinaria pesada y demolición, Jose trabaja alrededor de 9 horas y cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es atento y amable con sus clientes.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda podrá comprar más herramientas como martillos percutores, taladros, entre otros lo que le permitirá atender a sus clientes y poder seguir trabajando y mejorando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una ferretería”.
texts.en:
Jose is a very hardworking man. He lives in the city of Nazca, and with a lot of effort, he succeeded in starting his business of selling tools for heavy machinery and demolition. Jose works around 9 hours, and he believes that his business is going well for him because he is attentive and friendly to his customers.

Jose is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their great help, he will be able to buy more tools like hammer drills and regular drills, among others. This will enable him to attend to his customers and be able to continue working and improving in order to make his great dream a reality: "To have a hardware store".

loans.use: to purchase tools.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 64 años de edad vive junto a su menor hijo en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica al comercio de todo tipo y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella nos explica que se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir su taller está ubicado en su domicilio, con la ayuda de su hijo crían animales menores patos, gallinas y cuyes que luego de engordarlos los ofrecen en el mercado de la zona.

Son una familia unida, Francisca ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de confección telas, hilos y una segunda parte para alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecerlos a sus clientes, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is 64 years old. She lives together with her youngest son in the district of Zaña. Its residents work in all types of business and in agriculture. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

She explains to us that she works sewing garments. Her shop is located in her house. With the help of her son, they raise young animals – ducks, hens, and guinea pigs – that they sell in the area’s market after fattening them.

They are a united family. Francisca has requested a loan of 2500 nuevos soles for the purchase of tailoring materials like fabric and thread, and a second part for balanced feed for fattening her animals, and in this way have better production to offer her clients, generating additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials: thread and fabric; and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Miguel Etasnislado

texts.es: El señor Miguel, agricultor todo su vida, ademas de trabajar la tierra es labora como Guarda de Seguridad, su compañera de vida trabaja como domestica en una casa privada, entre los dos luchan dia a dia por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, actualmente el señor Miguel necesita dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de Piña, ya que asi aprovecharia las lluvias para que su cosecha este limpia de plagas, comprara: Urea, Triple, Completo 20-60-20, Divion, Gesepex, etc. el espera contar siempre con el apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva, ya que gracias a ellos su economia a mejorado un poco.
texts.en:
Miguel has been a farmer all his life, but apart from this job, he is also a security guard.  His partner works as a maid in a house.  Between the two, they strive each day to improve their situation.  At the moment, Miguel needs to treat his pineapple crop, so he can make the most of the rain and keep his harvest free of pests.  He will buy urea, fertilizers, herbicides and other agricultural supplies.  

He hopes to always be able to count on Afodenic and Kiva funds, given that thanks to their help, he has improved his financial situation a little.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es: Carlos de 36 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 17 años, 15 años, 13 años y 8 años de edad. Para Carlos lo más importante es que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades de vida a las que él y su esposa han tenido y es por eso que trabaja muy duro como albañil en diferentes zonas de su localidad.  Con sus ingresos y los de su esposa quien trabaja como vendedora de pan dulce mantienen la economía de su casa y poco a poco van sacando adelante a sus hijos. Su casa es muy pequeña y ya no es cómoda para toda la familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo mayor. Con el crédito comprará lámina, ladrillo, arena, y cemento. Expresa tener la capacidad para cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos, 36, lives in humble conditions with his wife and four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 8.  The most important thing for Carlos is that his children have better opportunities in life than he and his wife have had.  For this reason, he works very hard as a builder in different areas of his town.  With this income, together with his wife’s, who works as a sweet bread seller, they keep the house going and little by little they provide for their children.

Their house is very small and is no longer comfortable for all the family, so they are asking for a loan from FUSAI to be able to build a bedroom for the eldest brother.  With the loan, he will buy sheets of material, bricks, sand and cement.  He stresses that he has the capability to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy sheets of material, bricks, sand and cement to build a room.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora tiene 70 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica al cultivo de algodón, arroz, maíz y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella nos explica que apoya a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su hogar, dedicándose a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, su esposo se dedica a labores agrícolas en la zona.

Pastora ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar aves de corral y ofrecerlos en los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pastora is 70 and lives with her family in Oyotun, a small community which is two hours away from Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  In this area, people typically work growing cotton, rice, corn and selling small farm animals.

She tells us that she helps her husband with the household expenses by raising and selling farm animals, which she keeps at the back of her house.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Pastora has asked for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy poultry which she can sell in the small villages nearby and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy poultry for farming

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Абдурасулу из города Худжанд 28 лет. Он женат, но детей еще не имеет. Абдурасул владеет маленьким цехом по выпечке хлеба. Цех открылся 4 года назад. Для Абдурасула он приносит не большой доход. Потому что он только начинает развивать свой бизнес. Абдурасул не останавливается на достигнутом и идет вперед. Он хочет взять кредит на сумму 3000$ чтобы купить большую духовку для выпечки кондитерских изделий. 
    Когда он приобретет духовку, соответственно работы тоже будет больше. Ему будет помогать жена. Если ранее Абдурасул работал один, то в будущем они будут работать вместе. Абдурасул надеется, что он сделал правильный выбор и в будущем он сможет успешно развивать свой малый бизнес.
texts.en: Abdurasul is from Khujand.  He is 28 years old and married, but he does not yet have children.  Abdurasul runs a small bakery which opened four years ago and brings him a small income.  Since he has just started to increase his business, Abdurasul will keep moving forward.  He wants to get a loan of $3,000 to buy a big oven in which to make his baked goods.  When he gets the oven, his workload will increase.  His wife will help him; if Abdurasul worked alone before, then they will work together in the future.  He hopes that he has made the right choice and in the future he will be able to successfully increase his small business.

loans.use: to buy a stove for baking pastries

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru: Холмуроду 46 лет. Он живет и работает в селе Яванского района. Основным видом деятельности для Холмурода и жителей Явана является скотоводство и растениеводство. Холмурод такими деятельностями занимается очень давно. Он проживает и кормит свою семью за счет своей земли и скотов. Холмурод успешно занимается выращиванием коров и посевом сельскохозяйственных культур в течение 10 лет. В Таджикистане осень проходит почти не заметно, лето задерживается на долгое время и сразу приходят холода. Несмотря на то что на данный момент в Яване по летнему тепло, холода остались не за горами. Холмурод берет кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения, обработать землю и подготовить к посеву.
texts.en: Holmurod is 46 years old.  He lives and works in a village in the Yavan region of Tajikistan.  Holmurod, along with most of people living in Yavan, raises livestock and grows crops for a living, and has been at it for quite some time.  He lives off the land, feeding himself and his family through the crops he grows and the animals he raises.  Holmurod has successfully been engaged in the farming and animal husbandry for 10 years.  Autumn in Tajikistan goes by almost unnoticed; the summer weather does not end with summer, and the winter cold sets in not long thereafter.  At the moment, Holmurod is seeking a loan to stock up on mineral fertilizers to prepare the soil for sowing.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers to prepare the soil for sowing

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход проживает в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. Ему 36 лет. Он женат и имеет двух сыновей и дочь. Жена Фархода работает в стеклотарном заводе. Сам Фарход, чтобы обеспечивать семью работает на двух работах не жалея сил, поскольку дети растут и семейные раходы тоже увеличиваются. Фарход в течение 15 лет работает в экологическом центре. Одновременно последние два года он занимается купле-продажей рыбы. Его старший сын в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет факультет "Финансы и кредит". А младший сын и дочь еще учатся в школе. Фарходу в данный момент необходимо оплатить за обучения сына в университете по контракту. Это большая сумма для их семьи и по причине нехватки финансов он решил обратиться за кредитом. Фарход очень хочет, чтобы его сын получил высшее финансовое образование и развивался в этом направлении, так как у его сына хорошие аналитические способности, которые необходимо развивать.
texts.en:
Farhod, age 36, lives in the Ghafurov district of the city of Khujand.   He is married and the father of two sons and a daughter.  His wife works for a glass factory. With his children growing up and family expenses increasing, Farhod himself holds two jobs and spares no effort  to provide for his family. 

Farhod has been working at the Ecology Center for the past 15 years.  At the same time, he has been buying and selling fish for the past two years.  This year, his oldest son graduated from high school and enrolled at the "Finance and Credit" School of the Khujand State University.  His youngest son and daughter are still in school.  

Farhod currently needs to pay his son's tuition fees at the University, which represent a large amount of money for the family.  Since he doesn't have the necessary funds, he has decided to apply for a loan.  Farhod really wants his son to get a higher education in the field of finance and to pursue his studies in this direction, as he has good analytic skills which should be developed.

loans.use: to pay for his son's higher education costs.

loans.name: Saikal

texts.ru: Сайкал 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Сайкал - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Сайкал занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сайкал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, 6 овец, а также имеет 10,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает клевер и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайкал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сайкал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Saikal is 34 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Saikal has a higher education and works as a teacher at a local school. To provide additional income for her family, Saikal is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 14 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Saikal's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 2 calves, 6 sheep and also 10 hectares of land, where she annually grows clover and wheat. The monthly income amounts to 5,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Saikal requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount. Saikal plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Jarkynay

texts.ru: Жаркынай 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Жаркынай - неоконченное-высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жаркынай занимается полеводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жаркынай, на сегодняшний день имеется: 5,99 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, сеет зерновые культуры и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаркынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля элитного сорта, семян ячменя для посевных работ. Жаркынай хочет заняться дополнительно животноводством и доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует вложить в покупку домашней скотины, а также планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Jarkynay is 25 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband. She did not complete her higher education degree.  She is now involved in agriculture, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business seven years ago with a capital of 6,000 som (KGS.

Thanks to Jarkynay's hard work, her farming business now comprises 5.99 hectares of land on which she grows potatoes annually and sows crops and sainfoin for the family's consumption and also for resale. She makes a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Jarkynay has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy a high-end variety of potato seeds as well as barley seeds for sowing. 

Jarkinay plans to get involved in animal husbandry as well and re-invest some of her profits back into her business by purchasing livestock. She is also planning to save enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a high-end variety of potato seeds as well as some barley seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Salyimabubu

texts.ru: Салыймабубу 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Салыймабубу - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Салыймабубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Салыймабубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салыймабубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Салыймабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en: Salyimabubu is 39 years old, married, and has two children with her spouse. She has a vocational high school education. The sole source of income for the family is Salyimabubu's business raising animals. She started five years ago by buying 50,000 som (KGS) worth of livestock. Thanks to her tireless work, she currently owns two milk cows and 25 sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her business, Salyimabubu asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan for the purchase of cows to expand her herd. Salyimabubu plans to invest profit earned from use of the loan into further expanding the number of livestock she owns, and she also plans to save money to finish building a house.

loans.use: to purchase cows to expand her herd

loans.name: Lentush

texts.en:
Lentush lives in the village of Achajur, which is in the Tavush region.  He is 29 years old and he lives with his wife and two children (a girl and a boy).  His parents and his brother temporally live and work in the Russian Federation and they greatly help Lentush’s family overcome their family financial problems.  

Lentush is engaged in farming and it brings good income to his small family.  On his farm he breeds cows, calves and chickens.  He sells his farm products, which are milk and eggs, to his village food market. 

Lentush has some new plans connected with his farming and he is requesting a loan of 1,100,000 AMD in order to buy five horses.  With Nor Horizon, he has previously repaid three loans, always making his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy five horses which will help him in his farming.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq is a 33-year-old married person. Natiq is a hardworking and well known grocer. In his grocery store, he provides his neighborhood with canned foods, snacks, dairy products, juices, and drinks. He has long experience in this field and has gained his experience through working with his father ever since he was a young man.

He wants to solve some problems in his store and for that he needs a loan 900 AZN. He will use this loan to buy a new motor generator and to install some new shelves in his grocery store. Natiq believes that this loan will help him a lot in keeping his dairy products fresh and will satisfy his customers, thus he will gain a better reputation and grow bigger in the market.

loans.use: to install some new shelves in his grocery store

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.en:
Nurullo is a kind and responsible father and grandfather. He is 56 years old. He has two children and several grandchildren and has a big and happy family. Nurullo's wife is a housewife and helps with bringing up the grandchildren. Nurullo himself is engaged in the purchase, fattening and sales of livestock. He has been engaged in this business for a long time. In the summer season Nurullo brings his livestock to the pasture, and closer to winter, he brings them home for fattening . When his cattle are out on pasture Nurullo works in the field where he grows crops. Some extra income Nurullo receives from his son, who sends him money from Russia.

Nurullo has been a very long-term client of MDO " Arvand " and has been taking loans for several years for his business. Nurullo once again applied for a loan for the growth of its business. He plans to buy additional cattle and to increase his livestock . Nurullo expresses his gratitude to Kiva and Arvand for support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Matlubakhon

texts.ru: Матлубахон 56 лет, воспитывает 3 детей. После смерти супруга, Матлубахон очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Матлубахон решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки.  У Матлубахон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Матлубахон занимается животноводством, стартовав 35 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Матлубахон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,54 ГА, на котором выращивает картофель, хлопок и овощи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Матлубахон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Матлубахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en:
Matlubakhon is 56 years old and she raises three children.  It took her a very long time to recover from the death of her beloved husband.  But she had to raise and put her children back on their feet, so she decided to take responsibility for the business and material circumstances and she took the situation in her own hands.  Matlubakhon has a secondary education and she is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business 35 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she now owns two dairy cows and 5 sheep, and she cultivates 0.54 hectare (1.33 acre) of land on which she grows potatoes, cotton and vegetables. She makes a monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Matlubakhon has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some cows which she will fatten and then resell at a higher price at the market.

She plans to re-invest the profits from this loan back into her business by purchasing additional livestock. She is also planning to save enough money for the construction of a new building in which she will keep her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar is a first-year student at AUCA in the department of Economics. Here is his story.

“AUCA has everything I have been looking for in a university. Even though my high school career has been one I’ve struggled through, I am confident I can continue my education successfully at AUCA. AUCA’s economics program is extremely reputable. I am sure that the education I receive at AUCA will be unrivaled. With the combination of AUCA’s reputable economics program I will become a high qualified economist. With the large amount of resources at my disposal, the inspiration student body and community and a highly ranked economics program, AUCA is my ideal school to jumpstart my career in economics and also improve my English. 

My teacher has told me that AUCA was rated as top university, a very impressive accomplishment considering the amount of all universities in Kyrgyzstan. AUCA’s prestigious economics program combined with all the conditions to study creates an ideal package I’ve been searching for in a prospective university. AUCA is a perfect place for me to continue my career goals and follow my economic endeavors.  Another thing I would like to mention is that AUCA gives many opportunities to all its students. The loan opportunity is among those opportunities. I would like to take this opportunity to apply for a Kiva loan, which is a great chance to be able to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is 34 years old, a single woman living in Haja, Yemen. She owns a small house that started by her buying a small piece of land. This took great effort on her part. Recently, she would like to complete building her house. She has applied for a loan from AMB to buy construction materials like cement to use for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement to use for her house.

loans.name: Umar Bongo
loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials for resale

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 20 membres dynamiques et solidaires qui font comme activités le commerce et l'embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 02 garçons. Son activité principale est le commerce d'oseille et de pain de singe. Elle fait cette activité depuis qu'elle est majeure. Elle fait comme activité parallèle l'embouche ovine. 
Elle achète 04 bassines d'oseilles à 3000 F l'unité qu'elle va revendre à 5000 F et 03 bassines de pain de singe à 2500 F l'unité qu'elle revend à 4500 F. Elle achète aussi un mouton à 30 000 F qu'elle élève et au bout de 05 mois le revendre à 50 000 F.
Avec les bénéfices qu'elle génère, elle renforce son épargne et entretien ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 20 dynamic and interdependent members, who are active in retail commerce and the fattening of livestock.

Fatou, standing to the right of the photo and raising her hand is 65 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children including two boys.

Her main activity is the trade of sorrel and "pain de singe" (fruit of the baobab tree). She has been conducting this activity since she became an adult. As a parallel activity she fattens sheep.

She buys four basins of sorrel at 3,000 francs a unit that she resells at 5,000 francs, and three basins of baobab fruit at 2,500 francs a unit she resells at 4,500 francs. She also buys a sheep for 30,000 francs she then raises and resells after five months for 50,000 francs.

With the profits she generates, she bolsters her savings and supports her grandchildren.

loans.use: Buy sorrel and "pain de singe" (fruit of the baobab tree)

loans.name: Akoele

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 28ans, Akoeté est revendeur de fers à ses clients. Il le fait de façon ambulante et sollicite son second prêt pour en acheter d'avantage. Marié, il a 02 enfants(06 et 02ans) dont 01 scolarisé. Il espère à l'avenir ouvrir un magasin et assurer au mieux au besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
A young 28-year-old man, Akoété is a dealer in metal parts. He conducts his business as an itinerant salesman and is requesting his second loan to buy more metal.

He is married with two children (six and two years old) with one in school.  In the future he hopes to open a store and meet as best he can his family's needs.

loans.use: buy metal for resale

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2005, madame Ayaovi pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, fait sa première demande à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Mariée, elle a 02 enfants(06ans et 03 mois). Le profit l'aidera à assurer une bonne scolarisation à ses derniers et ouvrir une boutique de pagnes.
texts.en:
A retailer of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) since 2005, Ms. Ayaovi is requesting a first loan from WAGES, to buy more goods so she can better meet the needs of her customers.

She is married and has two children (six years and three months old). The profits will help ensure a good schooling for her children and enable her to open a pagnes shop.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Intumwa Group

texts.fr:
Pascaline fait partie du groupe  Intumwa et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 27 ans et est mariée à Justin. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 1 à 8 ans, 2 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants , membres de sa famille élargie, qui étudient.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis 5 ans  et vend des habits. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait ouvrir une boutique  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Pascaline is part of the Intumwa group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 27 years old and is married to Justin. Together they have three children aged one to eight years, of whom two attend school. She has two other children under her care, members of her extended family, who attend school.

She has been a hairdresser for the past five years, and also sells clothing.

This is her second credit loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan she obtains, she will increase her working capital and buy a lot of clothes for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, she wants to open a shop and see to her children's education.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a lot of clothes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco, desde muy joven sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo agricola, su esposa tiene como actividad comercial venta de frutas que son las que cosecha su esposo, con este credito el dara mantenimiento a su cosecha de Piña, ya que esta pronta a reventar el fruto y quiere que sus piña sean de calidad, comprara. Completo, Triple, Urea y Fertilizante, Agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en:
Francisco learned to work in agriculture from his parents when he was very young.  His wife is in business selling the fruit her husband harvests.  With this loan he will provide maintenance for his pineapple crop because it is almost time for the fruit to ripen and he wants it to be of good quality.

He will buy: "Completo", "Triple", urea and fertilizer.  He is grateful for the support received from Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lonlongno-Djokoto Group

texts.fr: Mr Komlan âgé de 80ans est cultivateur de profession. Marié, il a 06 enfants tous scolarisés. En plus de son activité champêtre, il prépare de la boisson alcoolisée locale appelé SODABI. Il a démarré en 2003 et sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des engrais pour son activité agricole. Il a été nommé pour être le responsable du groupement constitué de femmes et d'hommes. Ils sont soient dans le stockage des céréales, le fumage des poissons, le commerce. Ils espèrent avec le profit disposer de plus de réserves et assurer les besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr Komlan is 80 years old and a farmer by profession. He is married with six children, all in school.

In addition to his agricultural work, he prepares a local alcoholic beverage called Sodabi. He began in 2003 and is requesting his second loan to buy fertilizer for his agricultural activity.

He was appointed to be the head of the group consisting of men and women. They are in the business of storing grain, smoking fish, or retail trading. 

They hope that with the profits they will have more stock and be able to meet family needs.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and raw materials

loans.name: Maria Benedicta

texts.es:
María Benedicta tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Salitral, una comunidad conocida por la venta de chicha de jora y ceviche, su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura, que pertenece a Morropon, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la venta de chicha de jora y cerveza, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Benedicta, 58, lives with her husband in the district of Salitral, a community known for selling "chicha de jora" (corn-based drink) and "ceviche" (seafood dish).  The local people are involved in commerce and agriculture in Morropon which is two hours from the city of Piura along the northern coast of Peru.

María Benedicta and her family work from home selling chicha de jora and beer.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,500 PEN to buy grocieries and expand her business in an aim to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Amparo Judith

texts.es:
Amparo vive e la ciudad de imperial trabaja como empleada en una empresa de transportes de su ciudad, hace un año; amparo con el fruto de su trabajo puede sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, amparo cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Amparo esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder colocar piso en su vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a a sus hijas”.
texts.en:
Amparo lives in the city of Imperial and has worked at a transport company there for a year.  With her income she is able to provide for her two children, ages nine and two.  She believes work is going well for her because she is very responsible.

Amparo is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help she is receiving so she can buy construction materials to put down flooring in her home.  It is now a dirt floor so the improvement will give her family more quality of life.  This will encourage her to continue striving toward her goal of "giving her children a professional career".

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Francisco David

texts.es: Francisco de 26 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo recién nacido. Francisco trabaja como empleado de una constructora cerca de su localidad y con los ingresos que percibe lleva el sustento a su casa. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que con el tiempo el techo del corredor y la cocina se ha deteriorado y es necesario hacer el cambio lo antes posible. También, desea hacer un muro de retención para dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, arena, ladrillo y cemento; ya que no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso. Francisco será quien realizará los trabajos por lo que se ahorrará la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Francisco, 26, lives with his wife and his newborn son. Francisco works for a construction company close to where he lives. With the income he receives, he brings food to his family’s table. 

He wants to make some home improvements. With time, the roof of his front porch and of his kitchen has deteriorated, so it needs to be replaced as soon as possible. He is also planning to build a retaining wall in order to make his house safer. This is why he is requesting a loan at FUSAI; he does not have the money to purchase the materials. He will buy galvanized sheets, wood, sand, brick and cement. Francisco will do the work himself, which will save him the cost of the labor.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix the roof in the front porch and the kitchen.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en la zona rural de Oyotún, una comunidad con clima agradable, su población se dedica al comercio, cultivos de arroz, yucas, maíz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales pavos, patos, cerdos, nos explica que se dedica a esta actividad para poder sostener su hogar.

Es una madre emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio y así generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 25, lives with her children in the rural area of Oyotún, a community with a mild climate.  The local people work in trade and cultivation of rice, yucca plant, and corn.  Oyotún is two hours form the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Beatriz raises and sells animals such as turkeys, ducks and pigs in order to earn an income to support the household.  She is an enterprising mother who has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy small animals to raise and sell for the best price possible in an aim to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy small animals such as ducks, turkeys and hens.

loans.name: Basidelez

texts.es:
Basidelez tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en la zona rural de Sallique, a 90 minutos de la ciudad de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de limón acido y ganadería, que pertenece a Jaén, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El es muy conocido en su zona por dedicarse a brindar el servicio de maestro de obra en construcción, tiene una familia unida, su esposa le apoya en el pequeño negocio que tiene en su domicilio en la venta de granos como son menestras, maíz, trigo.

Basidelez ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de herramientas para su trabajo de maestro de obras de construcción cascos, guantes, algunos moldes y una segunda parte para abastecer su negocio con víveres arroz, aceite, fideos, menestras para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Basidelez, 47, lives with his wife and children in the rural area of Sallique, which is 90 minutes from the city of Pucará.  The local people grow lemons and work in livestock farming.  The area belongs to Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He is very well known in the area because he provides service as a master builder.  He has a well-knit family and his wife supports him by running a small business at home selling grains such as corn and wheat, and groceries.

Basidelez has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy work tools for construction, such as hardhats, gloves, and molds.  He will use the rest to buy groceries for the business such as rice, oil, noodles, and vegetables to offer customers and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy work tools: hardhats and gloves, and to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: Jose Anacleto

texts.es: José de 37 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes y sencillas junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañera de vida y sus dos  hijos de 19 años y 7 años de edad. Desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja como empleado de una empresa cercana a su localidad  de esa forma mantiene a su querida familia.  Su principal patrimonio es su casa la cual es de bahareque, sencilla y un poco deteriorada. Por lo anterior desea construir una nueva casa en su terreno ya que no se siente muy seguro en la vivienda actual. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, grava y arena. Espera poder contar con este apoyo lo antes posible ya que para José es muy importante mudarse lo antes posible.
