Reyna is a fighter and a responsible person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras together with her husband and four children who support her in her business. She has been making and selling tortillas for the past three years. She is well-known and visited by her neighbors in her community.

Reyna needs a loan to buy more raw materiel like lime, wood and corn that she needs to make her product. She hopes that the loan will help her a lot as thanks to it she can be sure to have the necessary ingredients on hand to make her product. She hopes that her sales will increase and with that she can raise her family's quality of living. At the same time she hopes that the business grows and that she can continue to support her family in fulfilling their dreams and goals.

Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2013

loans.use: to buy lime, wood and corn for her business.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is 22 years old. She lives together with her spouse and two daughters in her own home. She belongs to an ultra poor family. She got married a few years ago and at the time of her marriage, her husband did not have an occupation to afford the responsibility of a family. Therefore, she contacted the BRAC Pakistan for financial support. She took out her first loan for her husband and he started a blacksmith business. He purchased a welding plant and welding tools with the help of previous loans and is establishing his business. 
Now her husband wants to buy another welding plant with contribution from his savings because his previous welding plant is not working properly.
Therefore, Humaira requested a loan from BRAC, which is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant.
Humaira thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: A loan of $250 helps Humaira to purchase a welding plant for her husband.

loans.name: M. Tufail

texts.en:
M. Tufail is a milk seller by profession. His forefathers were doing the same business for many years and now most of his relatives are doing the same business. 

M. Tufail and his siblings inherited all of their buffaloes. He has been growing his herd of cattle through breeding. Now he has many buffaloes that produce milk.

He is famous in his hometown due to the quality and freshness of his milk. He preserves milk for household usage and sells milk in his hometown. His family has been growing for many years and this means a rapid increase in basic necessities. He has devoted one of his buffaloes to his family's needs, but this means that for his business, the milk runs short daily. He wants to buy another buffalo to fulfill the shortage of milk.

During his review, the field officer that met with him took his problem seriously and approved his desired loan. M. Tufail will be very happy after receiving this loan because the new buffalo will cause his herd to grow and reduce the shortage of milk.

He thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo in order to increase his milk sales.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
This is Rosela, 53, resident of Intramuros, Manila City, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a pipe fabricator, and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosela oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. She also sells dishwashing liquid and tocino for additional income. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Rosela hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Fiaz

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is Fiaz. He is 31 years old and lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He has been running a small general store for years, and the business is operating very well. His shop is situated in a populated area, and a lot of customers are available here to offer his miscellaneous general-store items. 

He does not want to refuse any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products that are necessary and consumable in daily routines. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. He wants to buy more quantities of all grocery items.

Therefore, Fiaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy all grocery items in greater quantity. 

He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. 

Fiaz is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and he assures that he will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy all grocery items in large quantity.

loans.name: Srey Oun

texts.en:
Srey Oun is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables, which she has been doing for more than four years. She earns about $5 a day. Her husband sells sand and earns about $3 a day. 

To improve her family’s finances, Srey Oun is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy more vegetables to sell and earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to purchase a store for selling vegetables and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she wants to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vaisola

texts.en:
Vaisola is 21 years old, with no children. She would like to start a small business, printing fabrics and selling "ie lavalava" in her community. In order to do this, Vaisola needs a loan to buy fabric color paints, rollers, brushes, materials and an "elei"-carved board. 

She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs. She is a new member of SPBD.

loans.use: to buy fabric color paints, rollers, brushes, materials and an elei-carved board

loans.name: Soninbayar

texts.en:
Soninbayar is 26 years old. He lives in Uvs province, Mongolia with his wife and two children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent house. His wife Baigalmaa helps her husband to run their family business of organic vegetable growing and sales. She currently stays at home taking care of their newborn baby. Their older son is three years old and goes to a local kindergarten. 
Soninbayar started their family business of organic vegetable growing and sales on their plot of land years ago. He sells his organic vegetables to retailers at a  local market. He is now planning to repair his storage pit, store vegetables and sell during the winter. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to repair his storage pit and build a greenhouse to extend the growing period of the year.

loans.use: to repair his storage pit and build a greenhouse to extend the growing period of the year

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
Mrs.Suhbaatar is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a small house in Uvs province. Her husband Anhtuya has started a taxi service business in town. Their sons, Amarbayasgalan and Anhsuh go to a local kindergarten. 
Mrs. Suhbaatar has worked in various fields for years and recently started her own business, a grocery store. She and her husband built a small house for family use and she is now running her business in a spare room of the house. She spent a specific amount of money for housing and workplace construction and her current assets decreased a bit. She needs 7,500,000MNT to purchase inventory for her business and insulation material, for her house and workplace, to install before the cold Mongolian winter comes. She is a hardworking and realistic person.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business and insulation material, for her house and workplace, to install before the cold Mongolian winter comes.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 personnes fait partie du banc villageois de Sarèmes Sérères qui a été créé le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité. Les membres sont solidaires et vivent dans la bonne entente. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de niébé et de mil. Elle achète du mil et du niébé qu'elle stocke chez elle et en période de soudure le revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires au plus offrant. Elle achète pour 03 barrigues de 100 Kg de mil entre 12 000 et 12 500 F la barrigue qu'elle revend à 250 F le Kg. Elle achète aussi 50 Kg de niébé à 250 F le Kg qu'elle revend à 350 F le Kg.
Avec les bénéfices, elle participe à la dépense journalière, aux soins médicaux des enfants et à leur bien-être. Elle satisfait aussi à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
This group of 26 members belongs to the Banc Villageois of Sarèmes Sérères, which was created on 13 December 2008. The group consists of people who live in the same district, who share a bond of solidarity and get along well. Their main activities are commerce and livestock fattening.

Fatou, age 43, is the group member standing on the right with her hand raised. She is married with 5 children, 3 of them boys. She is a reseller of niebe and millet, which she buys and stores in her home. In lean times, she sells her stock to the highest bidder at the local markets. 

Fatou typically buys three 100 Kg barrels of millet for 12,000 to 12,500 F each, which she sells for 250 F per Kg. She also buys 50 Kg of niebe for 250 F per Kg, which she sells for 350 F per Kg.

Fatou uses her profits to help cover the daily expenses as well as the children’s health care and general well-being. She also looks after her own needs.

loans.use: to buy millet and niebe.

loans.name: Sara Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Sara es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Su negocio la pesca y venta de mariscos y una pulpería tiene de dedicarse a estas actividades desde hace 10 años.
Doña Sara sus negocios son muy conocidos y visitados por personas de la comunidad y de las distintas localidades cercanas a la comunidad. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de unas redes de pesca las cuales necesita para seguir desarrollando su negocio. 
Doña Sara espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con las herramientas  necesarias para captar más producto y así satisfacer los pedidos y necesidades de los clientes, además desea un aumento en las ventas y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. 
Doña Sara su sueño es aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2013
texts.en:
Sara is a fighter and a hard-worker who lives in a community in the south of Honduras together with her husband and five children. For the past ten years she has been fishing, selling seafood and has a small store. Sara's businesses are well known and used by people from her community and the surrounding communities.

Sara is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets which she needs in order to carry on with her business. She expects the loan to help her a lot as she doesn't have the tools necessary to collect more product and satisfy the needs and demands of her customers. She also would like to see a raise in her sales and with this make more income which would improve her family's quality of living. Sara dreams of expanding her business and continue to support her children in their studies so that they have greater possibilities in their lives.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2013

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie, 45 years old, is an entrepreneur who is married with three children in Magsaysay, Panaon. He is earning from his motorcycle transport service business and has been operating this line of business for four years. He joined GDMPC in 2012 and his previous loan was taken and used for motor accessories and was successfully repaid. He borrowed a new loan to buy a new set of tires. In the future, he wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Suhtulga

texts.en:
Suhtulga is 37 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school. They live in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent house, in Uvs, Mongolia. His wife takes care of their new twin boys.  Suhtulga operates a wood furniture manufacturing business from home, which he has been doing for four years. He also provides transportation services with a small van to increase his income. 

Suhtulga is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase wood for his furniture manufacturing business to meet his clients' order on time.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his furniture manufacturing business

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en: Akhtar is a 55-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an un-stitched clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of her business. For that, Akhtar is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase variety of clothes to sell. This way he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit amount he will put aside some savings to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Akhtar hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 46 years old and the mother of six children. 

Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to buy a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Shehnaz, as a member of the three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase what he needs with the help of loan amount. 

Shehnaz is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials, including threads, needles, clothing, etc

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 52, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Avelino and they have two children who are both studying. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Alicia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Alicia dreams to have another stall and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara started BLS Eldercare in February 2009. As a qualified financial planner “looking for her niche,” Barbara was introduced to Veteran’s benefits and began leading seminars on the subject at assisted living communities. Barbara now offers an affordable alternative for elder care financial planning through her business. 
 
Having graduated with a BS in Medical Computer Science, an MS in Electrical Engineering, as well as acquiring an MBA degree, Barbara is more than qualified to run an establishment of this nature. Barbara is a Registered Financial Gerontologist, passing the comprehensive certification with distinction. She is also a graduate of The College for Financial Planning. Barbara's compassionate approach to working with families is what distinguishes the business from others in the industry.

Barbara also has developed a unique system called “Care-culator,” which is used internally to help answer questions about the financial impact of elder care, using different scenarios. The funds from this loan will go towards the development of this beneficial tool, and will cover the programming and marketing expenses, including website development. Barbara's goal is to market and license this product as a consumer tool.

loans.use: to cover programming and marketing expenses, including website development, for a system called "Care-culator".

loans.name: Esther Sara

texts.en: Esther dreams of becoming a communications expert but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Esther is currently attending the Universidad Mayor de San Simon, working towards her degree in communications. She plans to graduate in August 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With this loan, Esther plans to purchase her much- needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Esther feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a career in communications, she expects to earn $10 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling attending college already, Esther is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose dreams of working for the environment. Jose was accepted into the Universidad Boliviana de Venezuela and now, with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. He plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. Jose plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in environmental evaluation before graduating. 

For his family of six, finances have always been tight. With three older siblings attending college already, Jose is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Jose's father works as a craftsman and his salary is the family's primary source of income. To help out, Jose began working at age 18 and continues to work 30 hours a week and earns $10 a day. With a degree in environmental evaluation he expects to earn $19 a day.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.en:
Maria dreams of becoming a business administrator but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Maria was accepted into the Universidad Tecnologiaca Privada Cosmos and now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

With this loan, Maria plans on paying her tuition while she saves her salary from her part-time job. Maria currently works 40 hours a week as a receptionist. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business administration, she expects to earn $17 a day, a substantial increase from before. Unfortunately, Maria's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Maria hopes to be the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Vaiola

texts.en:
Vaiola is 53 years old and married, with four children. 

She has a plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. Vaiola has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, a water gallon, and a crowbar.

She has been a member of SPBD in 2009. Vaiola will spend her profits to help her plantation and also her family's standard of  living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, a water gallon, and a crowbar

loans.name: Fai

texts.en:
Fai is 27 years old, single, and has one child. She operates a store selling sugar, flour, noodles, etc. in her community, which she has been doing for four years. 

Fai is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy sugar, rice, noodles, tinned fish, mosquito coils, milk, snacks, flour, and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to help her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice,noodles, tinned fish, mosquito coils, milk, snacks, flour, and soft drinks

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 35-year-old woman who is not  married and has 6 children. She runs a business selling sugar, flour, noodles etc. in her community; she has 4 years of experience with this business. 

Joyce has requested a loan to buy flour, rice, noodles, milk, soap, laundry powder, matches, toilet rolls, sugar and soy sauce. She plans to use her profits to help improve both her family's standard of living and her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, noodles, milk, soap, laundry powder, matches, toilet rolls, sugar and soy sauce

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She has makes and sells ice cake in her community. 

Palepa is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a cooler, foam cups, plastic bags, cordials, and sugar. In the future, she hopes to use her profits to meet her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, foam cups, plastic bags, cordials, and sugar

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be social. She operates a retail shop where she sells printing papers, books, and other stationery. She describes her family challenge to be lack of water storage facilities. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en: Eddah is a 48-year-old married woman. She has six children between the ages of 3 and 22. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas, tomatoes, and other vegetables. Her business is located in a high potential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be change in demand. She will use the 7,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house at night. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and married with four children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Delia has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Delia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children.  She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda and has been running a restaurant alongside a retail shop.  She uses her proceeds to pay for her children's school fees.

Like most people in this line of business she is challenged by price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet the demand.   Her dream is to own one of the modern restaurants in town.

Fatuma is requesting this loan to buy food to sell in the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in the restaurant.

loans.name: Equelyn

texts.en:
Equelyn is 29 years old, married, and has seven children, five of whom attend school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Equelyn is requesting her ninth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Equelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old John, who lives in Kitale, where he has been practicing farming for seven years.

He does dairy, poultry, and crop farming, which is his actual source of income. He enjoys doing farming and more especially dairy farming, while his major challenge is getting feed for his livestock.

John said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer good products that suit low-income earners.

This loan will help John purchase a dairy cow, which will increase his milk production and thus improve his income base. This will enable him to give his family a better life and grow his businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 47,600 to purchase beans, rice, and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a forty-year-old divorced woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells cassava flour and she started the business in order to earn money to support her family. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations affect her business growth while her desire is to diversify and trade in other food crops such as maize and beans. Florence is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Maria Stephany

texts.en: Maria dreams of becoming an international trade manager but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. To achieve her goal, Maria has enrolled in the Universidad Tecnológica Boliviana. She plans to graduate in September 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With this loan, Maria plans to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in international trade management before graduating. To help afford her school and living expenses, Maria currently works 40 hours a week as a secretary. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With one younger brother, Maria hopes to be a role model for her younger sibling by being the first in her family to graduate from a university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Viancka Beatriz

texts.en: Viancka dreams of becoming an accountant but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. To achieve her goal, Viancka has enrolled in ISECA. She plans to graduate in November 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With this loan, Viancka plans to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in accounting before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Viancka currently works 30 hours a week and earns $13 a day. With a degree in accounting, she expects to earn $22 a day. With one younger brother and two younger sisters, Viancka hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from a university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Gayatri

texts.en:
Gayatri is 38 years old and widowed, living with her son and daughter, aged 14 and 16 years respectively. Three years ago, her husband passed away in an accident. That was very hard time for her because the entire family burden came on her. In those days she had two cows so she managed her family expenses by selling milk, but that was not sufficient. After one year she purchased another cow to earn more money as her children's study expenses are increasing.

Now she wants to purchase another jersey cow so that she can sell more milk and milk products. She said, "If I get a jersey cow, I can sell more milk so I can spend more money on my children's studies." She has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing a jersey cow. She wants her children to graduate from a good college and she needs to save some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a jersey cow.

loans.name: Kaneezan

texts.en:
Kaneezan is 40 years old and the mother of six daughters. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Kaneezan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needful things with the help of loan amount. 

Kaneezan is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy a tailoring machine and zippers, reels, buttons, laces, threads, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a hardworking mother who  has a poultry business to earn a living and meet the needs of her family.The previous loan helped her to buy chicken feed and chicks which is boosting her business. In addition she sells fish to supplement her income. Here again, she is requesting a loan of Kshs 15,000 to buy more fish and cooking oil for frying fish for sale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cooking oil for frying fish for sale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a firewood-selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nazareth está conformado por ocho integrantes, seis mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de león. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Algunos de sus integrantes lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar, una carrera para trabajar y ayudar a sus familias ya que vivían en  pobreza extrema. Pero gracia a su espíritu de superación y su voluntad han podido salir adelante.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal es  Ruth y tiene por actividad económica una ferretería ubicada en su casa de habitación. el cual vende material de ferretería  como zin, hierro, clavos, tomas corriente, extensión, alambre, palas, hachas, escobas, perlines, cal, cemento, escaleras, mangueras. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de ferretería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Nazareth agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y a países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nazareth is made of eight members, six women and two men, mothers and fathers, who have between them 15 children. They are from Malpaisillo, located in the western zone of Leon. They are know for being responsible workers, with desires to do their best. Some of the members were not able to study because of lack of financial resources, and so they live in extreme poverty. But thanks to their optimistic spirit, and their strength of will, they have been able to improve their lives. 
Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead, the coordinator of the bank is Ruth. She has a supply store located in her home, where she sells zinc, steel, nails, breaker boxes, extension cables, wires, shovels, axes, brooms, beams, calcium, cement, stairs and cables. She works for 10 hours a day, selling her products. The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her store so she can buy and sell construction supplies, so that in the not so distant future she can earn more money. The communal bank Nazareth is thankful for the help of the lenders at Kiva because they give opportunities to those with limited means and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock their store.

loans.name: Suraubai

texts.en:
Mr. Suraubai is 45-years-old and lives with his wife and 3 children in their house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is a nurse at the local hospital and his children are local primary and secondary school students.
 
Suraubai has been providing a year-round livestock retail business in a local outdoor market; he purchases livestock from herders and sells it to local residents. His high season is winter but working conditions are tough. He has been providing good and friendly service to the local residents for years now and is well-known among them.  

He is requesting this loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large number of livestock from herders in the countryside. He is a hardworking, friendly and helpful man.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of livestock from herders in the countryside

loans.name: Suvdaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Suvdaa is a 30-year-old single mother of one, living in a Ger (traditional nomadic tent), in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2003. She has attended several certificate trainings to strengthen her skills as hairdresser. She is a thoughtful, hardworking, and welcoming lady who provides good services to her clients. 

She just started renting the seat at the local market. She is now requesting loan of 4,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of inventories, including shampoos, treatments, sprays, etc., before prices go up. She manages to take care of her child and the child's education while she runs her small hairdressing for a living.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventories, including shampoos, treatments, sprays, etc., before prices go up.

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Phoem is 48 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She receives support from her children. Two of her children are employed. They are a driver and a garment worker. They earn about $9 each day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Phoem is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her children easily get to work and reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland for growing rice and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Robina.  Robina lives in the Kitale area of Kenya and has been a farmer for 5 years.  She farms dairy, poultry and crops and sells her produce (milk, eggs and crops) at the local market. In farming, she loves rearing poultry because of the eggs that they produce which she sells in the local market. The challenge she faces is expensive animal feed.

Robina chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer good services for their products. During the training session she learnt how to develop a culture of savings.

This loan will help her purchase more poultry, which will produce more eggs and, thus, more income. This will improve her family's living standards

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a 42-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not facilitate him in meeting the day-to-day needs of his family, he decided to venture into the motorcycle transport business. 

High fuel prices and poor road network limit his profits, while his dreams are to educate his children up to the university and buy at least five motorcycles, which he intends to hire out to riders who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings. 

Deo is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ma. Eleonor

texts.en:
This is Ma. Eleonor, 44, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Eleonor operates an accounting firm. She has two regular employees and two part-time workers. She has been in this business for fifteen years now. She acts as the owner and manager of the firm Her regular customers are students and the local community. She earns a minimum of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 45,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy laptops that will be used in their office.

Ma. Eleonor hopes that her business will grow and expand and have a printing press soon. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for laptops that will be used in their office.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George a 41-year-old farmer who lives in Kitale, an area where there is high maize production. He has been in farming for seven years, doing poultry, dairy and crop farming, which are his sources of income. He loves poultry farming more because in Kitale, there is a high consumption of poultry products.

George chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund him because he will be able to get a loan to purchase poultry at a low interest rate. During the training given, he learnt that he should develop a culture of savings in order to develop well. This loan will benefit his family in that more eggs will be produced and sold. Thus, their income will increase and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rwengoma Twkirize Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. She is a forty-nine-year-old single mother of four children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after her children. Her greatest desire is to educate them up to university. 

After separating from her husband, she decided to venture into goat-selling, and she also set up a retail shop. She has been in business for six years. She has a challenge of limited capital to meet the demand of her customers, and her dream is to own a ranch. Elizabeth intends to use the loan to buy goats, rice, sugar, and soap to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy goats, rice, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Michaeline

texts.en: Michaeline is a 43-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for 10 years and does farming in order to earn additional income. She started her business in order to educate her children and improve their standards of living. Ever-changing customer preferences and inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business growth while her desire is to own a modern boutique that keeps up with the trends. Michaeline is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has two children, both of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over 10 years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains and garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase material and thread for her business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is widowed and has five children, three adults, one in school, and one underage. She operates a charcoal business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Asha is requesting a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She joined Yehu to get financial support. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla operates a fish selling business. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and stiff competition.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Jose Rufino

texts.es:
José, necesita capital para adquirir insumos agrícolas  para el cultivo de granos básicos  comprara  abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, semillas, y el resto lo invertirá en complementar la compra de un terreno para construir una casa a futuro para sus hijos. Con el crédito anterior el obtuvo una cosecha abundante, mejoro su economía  y sus clientes están más satisfechos.
Sigue trabajando para que sus hijos crezcan en una casa propia y tengan un futuro con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: José needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, weed killer, and seed to grow basic grain crops. He will also buy some land where he will build a house for his children. He produced a great crop, improved his finances, and satisfied his customers with the previous loan. He will keep working to ensure that his children grow up in their own house and have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, weed killer, and seed.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, está satisfecha con la institución y a decidido seguir trabajando con créditos es por eso que optado por invertir nuevamente más en su negocio en esta ocasión realizara la compra de arroz, jabón, chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, bebidas varias, aderezos, etc. Con el crédito anterior ella surtió la tienda y agrego otra actividad económica como es la venta de pupusas en su residencia, aumento sus ganancias,
Ella trabaja para seguir adelante con el negocio, salir con sus deudas, y continuar apoyando a su familia.
texts.en: María is satisfied with the institution and decided to continue working with the loans and so she has decided to make a new investment in her business and this time she will purchase rice, soap, chicharron, cheese, beans, oil, sugar, drinks, seasonings etc. With the previous loan, she stocked her store and she was able to begin another activity to earn money: selling pupusas (a traditional salvadoran food). She works so she can improve her business, get out of debt and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: purchase rice, soap, chicharron, cheese, beans, sugar, drinks and more.

loans.name: Dominga Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Dominga, tiene 57 años de edad, administra un negocio familiar en conjunto con su hija y dos personas más que realizan la mano de obra. Su negocio consiste en la fabricación de cocinas industriales hechas a base de metal, las cuales son muy  demandados porque son utilizadas por otros pequeños negocios de fritanga, tortillerías y carritos de hamburguesas entre otros tipos de comidas rápidas, también elaboran basureros de metal  y  rotulaciones en general. Dominga es una mujer emprendedora que solicita este primer crédito con Afodenic y Kiva con el objetivo de invertir en materia prima como tubos galvanizados, angulares, perlines, quemadores, pinturas, selladores y válvulas, para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y nuevos clientes.
texts.en: Doña Dominga is 57 years old and runs a family business with her daughter and two others who perform the manual labor. Her business constructs industrial kitchens with metal bases, which are in demand because they are used by other small businesses like restaurants, tortilla shops and hamburger stands, among other fast foods, and she also makes metal based trash cans and general signs too. Dominga is an enterprising woman who is asking her for first loan from Afodenic and Kiva with the objective of investing the money in prime materials like galvanized tubes, angled beams, regular beams, burners, paints, sealants, and valves so she can meet current customer demand and that of new clients.

loans.use: purchase galvanized tubes, beams,burners, paint, sealants, valves and more.

loans.name: Tsagaan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsagaan is 50 years old and lives with her two sons in their house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her older son works at a local company and her younger son is a university student. 

Tsagaan started her business in 2005 in a rental booth of a local market and has been providing good-quality, tasteful clothing to local residents since then. She purchases her inventory twice a month from Erlian, China. She is well-known for her good service and stylish modern clothing. She is now requesting loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a large quantity of winter clothing to sell at her rental booth.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of winter clothing to sell at her rental booth

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús De Las Orquideas  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es: En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Niño Jesús De Las Orquídeas el cual está formado por 10 mujeres y 2 hombres, que con la ayuda del créditos están sacando adelante sus negocios y así mejorando la calidad de vida de sus familias, ellos se dedican a varias actividades en su mayoría al comercio. Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora María Magdalena, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y la menor de 12 años  que estudian en colegio y es la que aun vive con ellos. El marido es electricista. Doña María Magdalena desde hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en un cetro de la ciudad, con estos conocimientos ella se gana la vida ya que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que gana sobre todo para los gastos de su hija, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes en un taller de costura por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, pero además de trabajar para otra persona ella en las noches y fines de semana en su casa confecciona toda clase de prendas con lo cual se gana muy buenos ingresos, hay temporadas que tiene que madrugar para terminar sus obras ya que a ella le gusta cumplir como es debido con sus clientes.Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales de costura para confeccionar sus prendas. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el crédito salió rápido. Sus sueños es tener un taller en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en: In the township of Las Orquídeas of the city of Portoviejo, every fifteen days the communal bank Niño Jesús De Las Orquídeas meets. It is made up of 10 women and 2 men, and with the help of loans, they are improving their businesses and improving their quality of life and that of their families. They all have different businesses with most of them working in the commercial sector. One of the members of the group is Mrs. Maria Magdalena. She is 46 years old, married and has three children. Two of them are older and one of them only has 12 years old. They go to school and the youngest still lives with her. Her husband is an electrician. Mrs. Maria Magdalena learned how to cut and sew in the city a few years ago, and with this knowledge she has been earning a living because her husband is not able to earn enough to cover all the household expenses. She works Monday through Friday in a sewing workshop where she receives a monthly salary, but other than working there, she also works for herself in the evenings and on the weekends, making all kinds of clothes, and she is able to earn good money. There are times when she needs to rise with the dawn in order to finish her orders because she likes to finish on time, as promised to her customers. The loan is to purchase fabrics, threads and other sewing materials so she can continue sewing. This is her first loan with the communal bank and she likes it because she receives her loan quickly. Her dream is to have her own workshop in the center of town.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Rosa Lucia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 27 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar,Rosa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Rosa trabaja como obrera cajera en un centro de internet de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una refrigeradora para su vivienda, de esta manera ella y su familia podrán conservar adecuadamente sus alimentos, así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 27 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona with her parents and brothers. She is hard working, enthusiastic, and dedicates all her efforts to getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and because she needed to work, Rosa was not able to go to school. 
On her own initiative, Rosa began working as a cashier at an internet center in the city. She works everyday for around 10 hours and she thinks things are going well because of her dedication and her good performance.
Rosa is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva and it is thanks to their help that she will be able to purchase a refrigerator for her home. With the refrigerator, she and her family will be able to save their food and Rosa will continue working and striving towards her goal of having her own home.

loans.use: purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Fanny Ines

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos ya mayores de edad y estudian en universidad y  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Fanny para salir adelante junto a su familia y  mucho más ahora que su marido no trabaja, hace tiempo atrás puso una tienda de víveres en su casa, ella aprovecho el primer crédito que recibió del banco y así con los siguientes créditos lo fue mejorando, en la actualidad además de su tienda también tiene una copiadora en la cual vende útiles escolares, ella trabaja todos los días a veces sola y a  veces con la ayuda de su esposo o sus hijos cuando pueden, lleva 11 años con su negocio y espera seguir mejorándolo con el pasar de los días y con la ayuda de los créditos como lo ha hecho hasta el día de hoy.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus metas son tener la mejor tienda de su localidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Progresistas meets every two weeks in Jipijapa canton, an area named for the coffee sultan and known for its extensive coffee farms, which produce the most flavorful coffee, for its cuisine, and for its kind residents. Fanny, 51, lives here. She is married and has three grown children from this marriage, who are college students and still live with her. Her husband is retired.

Some time age, Fanny opened a small grocery shop in her house so that she could provide for her family, which she must do even more now that her husband doesn't work. She wisely used her first bank loan and the following to grow her business. Now she has a copying machine and sells school supplies. She mostly works alone every day, though her husband or children help out when they can. She has run her business for 11 years and hopes to continue making it stronger with the funding, as she has done previously. 

She will use this loan to stock her store and buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other basic goods. She has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years and is happy with the group because she started her business with the first loan. Her goal is to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 43-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a bar, but she is also involved in transport business in order to raise money to support her family. 

A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification, and set up other sustainable income-generating activities to earn more income. 

Inadequate capital and high license fees affect her business profits, while her goal is to own a modern bar that attracts executive customers. Rose intends to use the loan facility to buy beer, soda, and local brew to resell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, and local brew to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 29-year-old businessman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa. He also earns a salary as a civil servant at the district and operates a retail shop in order to raise money to meet his family's daily expenses. The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University and build rental houses to secure their future despite inadequate capital and unpredictable weather changes. His business goal is to trade in wholesale and expand his business to new markets. John will use the loan to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
This is Isabel, 60, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and she has eight children who are all working. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Isabel operates a food stall. She sells snacks like burgers, noodles, coffee and other street food staples and also cooked dishes in their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw ingredients like hamburger, noodles, coffee and other food staples.

Isabel hopes that her business will grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like hamburger, noodles, coffee and other food staples.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is aged 50, married, and they blessed with two children. She is engaged in hog raising and a retail business. At present, she is focusing on selling different goods in their village. She also raises hogs for additional income.

 Mila wishes for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy drinks, toothpaste, soap, noodles, and snack foods to sell in their village. Mila’s goal is to grow her business and she hopes to earn higher income to be able to support their family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, toothpaste, soap, noodles, and snack foods to sell in their village.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en: Mwanaharusi appreciates the previous loan that helped her in her water-selling business. Beside the water-selling business, she makes juice using fruit and sugar and sells it to her customers and passersby. She is requesting a loan of Ksh.50,000 to purchase a blender and fruit for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a blender and fruit for her business

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Анаркан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 3 теленка, 8 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). Анаркан входит в группу "Бакыт", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Анаркан является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома для сына.
texts.en:
Anarkan is 42 years old, married, and is raising three children with her husband. Anarkan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Anarkan is involved in raising livestock, having started ten years ago with the purchase of livestock for 12,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Anarkan today has on her homestead: six dairy cows, three calves, and eight goats. Monthly income consists of 13,000 som (KGS). 

Anarkan is the third member of the borrower group "Bakyt." With the aim of further developing her homestead, Anarkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves for increasing her livestock count. 

Anarkan plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for building a new home for her son.

loans.use: to buy calves
